projectDesc.p: "Just as the Elephant" is published by The Global Medieval Sourcebook (GMS), a free, open access, and open source compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. GMS comprises computer-readable transcriptions or editions alongside new translations of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia. The GMS platform includes critical introductions as well as sources for further reading.

editorialDecl.p: Transcriptions and translations are encoded in XML conforming to TEI (P5) guidelines. The original-language text is contained within <lem> tags and translations within <rdg> tags.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern American English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Scribal errors and creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.lem: Atressi cum l’orifans
app.rdg: Just as the Elephant

app.lem: que, quan chai, no·s pot levar
app.rdg: Which, when it falls, cannot get up

app.lem: tro l’autre ab lor cridar
app.rdg: Until the others, through their trumpeting,

app.lem: de lor votz lo levon sus,
app.rdg: Make it stand up with the sounds they emit,

app.lem: et ieu vuelh segre aquel us
app.rdg: I too want to follow this custom,

app.lem: quar mos mesfagz es tan greus e pezans
app.rdg: Because my wrongdoing is such a heavy burden

app.lem: que, si la cortz del Puey e lo bobans
app.rdg: That, if the court of Puy, and the pomp

app.lem: e l’adregz pretz dels leials amadors
app.rdg: And the rightful merit of the true lovers

app.lem: no·m relevon, ia mais no serai sors;
app.rdg: Do not get me back up, I will never be up on my feet again;

app.lem: que denhesson per me clamar merce
app.rdg: So may they deign to plead for mercy on my behalf

app.lem: lai on preiars ni razos no·m val re.
app.rdg: There where begging and arguing do not help me.

app.lem: E s’ieu per los fis amans
app.rdg: And if I, thanks to the refined lovers,

app.lem: non puosc en ioy retornar,
app.rdg: Cannot recover my joyfulness,

app.lem: per tostemps lays mon chantar
app.rdg: I will abandon my singing forever

app.lem: que de mi no y a ren plus;
app.rdg: Because there’s nothing left of me;

app.lem: ans viurai cum lo reclus,
app.rdg: Instead, I will be living like a recluse,

app.lem: sols, ses solatz, qu’aitals es mos talans,
app.rdg: Alone, without solace, for such is my state of mind;

app.lem: quar ma vida m’es enuegz et afans
app.rdg: Because my life bothers and pains me,

app.lem: e gaugz m’es dols e plazers m’es dolors,
app.rdg: And joy feels like sorrow and pleasure like pain,

app.lem: qu’ieu no suy ges de la maneira d’ors
app.rdg: Because I am not at all like the Bear,

app.lem: que, qui be·l bat ni·l te vil ses merce,
app.rdg: Which, when one beats it thoroughly and holds it in contempt, without mercy,

app.lem: adoncs engrayssa e melhuyra e reve.
app.rdg: Fattens, improves, and flourishes.

app.lem: Be sai qu’amors es tan grans
app.rdg: I know full well that love is so magnanimous

app.lem: que leu me pot perdonar,
app.rdg: That it can easily forgive me,

app.lem: s’ieu falhi per sobramar
app.rdg: If I failed it by loving excessively

app.lem: ni renhey cum Dedalus,
app.rdg: Or if I behaved like Daedalus,

app.lem: que dis qu’elh era Jhezus
app.rdg: Who said he was Jesus,

app.lem: e volc volar al cel outracuians,
app.rdg: And who wanted to fly to the sky in his arrogance

app.lem: mas Dieus baisset l’orguel e lo sobrans;
app.rdg: (But God abated his pride and his superiority);

app.lem: e mos orguelhs non es res mas amors,
app.rdg: And my pride is nothing but love,

app.lem: per que merces mi deu faire socors,
app.rdg: Which is why Mercy must come and rescue me,

app.lem: que maint luec son on razos vens merce,
app.rdg: For there are many instances in which arguing wins against mercy,

app.lem: e luec on dregz ni razos no·s ave.
app.rdg: And instances in which legitimacy and arguing do not prevail.

app.lem: A tot lo mon suy clamans
app.rdg: I complain to everyone

app.lem: de mi e de trop parlar;
app.rdg: About myself and about my vain discourse;

app.lem: e s’ieu pogues contrafar
app.rdg: And if I could imitate

app.lem: fenix, don non es mas us,
app.rdg: The Phoenix, of which there is but one,

app.lem: que s’art e pueys restortz sus,
app.rdg: Which lights up in flames and then recovers,

app.lem: ieu m’arsera, quar suy tant malanans,
app.rdg: I would light myself up in flames, because I am so unhappy,

app.lem: e mos fals digz mensongiers e truans
app.rdg: And my false, mendacious and vile utterance

app.lem: resorsera en sospirs et en plors
app.rdg: Will resuscitate as sighing and as weeping,

app.lem: lai on beutatz e iovens e valors
app.rdg: There where beauty and youthfulness and worth

app.lem: es, que no y falh mas un pauc de merce
app.rdg: Are, for it does not take more than just a little of mercy

app.lem: que no y sion assemblat tug li be.
app.rdg: For there to be everything that is good in one place.

app.lem: Ma chansos er drogomans
app.rdg: My song will be a fixer

app.lem: lai on ieu non aus anar
app.rdg: There where I do not dare to go

app.lem: ni ab dregz huelhs regardar,
app.rdg: Nor to look with a straight eye,

app.lem: tan sui forfagz e aclus;
app.rdg: So much am I guilty and constricted;

app.lem: e ia hom no m’en escus.
app.rdg: And indeed no one seeks to justify me.

app.lem: Mielhs-de-dona, que fugit ai dos ans,
app.rdg: Best-of-a-Lady, from whom I have fled for two years,

app.lem: er torn a vos doloiros e plorans;
app.rdg: Now I turn to you in pain and crying;

app.lem: aissi quo·l sers, que, quant a fag son cors,
app.rdg: Like the Stag, which, when it has run away,

app.lem: torna morir al crit dels cassadors,
app.rdg: Returns to die when the hunters shout,

app.lem: aissi torn ieu, domna, en vostra merce;
app.rdg: So do I return, Lady, to your mercy;

app.lem: mais vos no·n cal, si d’amor no·us sove.
app.rdg: But you do not care, and you are forgetful about love.

app.lem: Tal senhor ai, en cui a tan de be
app.rdg: I have a lord in whom there is so much goodness

app.lem: que·l iorn que·l vei non puosc faillir en re.
app.rdg: That when I saw him I could not wish for more.

app.lem: Belh Bericle, ioys e pretz vos mante;
app.rdg: Beautiful Beryl, joyfulness and worth assist you;

app.lem: tot quan vuelh ai, quan de vos me sove.
app.rdg: I have all that I want when I think about you.
